title: Advanced Epidemiologic Methods
description: This course will provide an in-depth overview of modern epidemiologic concepts, including fundamentals of causal inference; quantitative measures of occurrence, association, and effect; epidemiologic study design; epidemiologic data analysis; sources of bias in epidemiologic studies; and design and analytic strategies for the evaluation and mitigation of bias in epidemiologic studies. Prerequisites: must be enrolled in MPH program (FM75) or program approval and successfully completed FMPH 401.
